meanings.sent1: The baccate bush in our garden is full of ripe berries.
meanings.sent2: The forest was filled with baccate trees, offering a feast for the birds.
meanings.sent3: The baccate plant seemed to be playing hide-and-seek with the hungry squirrels.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a baccate melody, sweet and full of joy.
meanings.sent5: The baccate aroma of the pie filled the kitchen, tempting everyone to have a slice.

meanings.definition: Resembling or having the qualities of a berry.
meanings.sent1: The gemstone had a baccate shape, resembling a small berry.
meanings.sent2: Her cheeks turned a baccate red when she realized her mistake.
meanings.sent3: The baccate hat looked adorable on the little girl, like a berry atop her head.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a baccate quality, smooth and rich like a ripe berry.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky with baccate hues, as if nature itself was a giant berry basket.
